payload.instructions:
# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
Source code lives in `src`. Routes and layouts use the App Router under `src/app`, with segment folders like `src/app/[lineId]` for dynamic pages and `src/app/api` for server handlers. Reusable UI sits in `src/components`, while feature-specific logic is grouped inside `src/features/<feature>`. Shared hooks (`src/hooks`), database helpers (`src/lib`), and design tokens (`src/styles`) keep cross-cutting concerns centralized. Static assets (logos, favicons) belong in `public`. Keep new modules aligned with this layout so imports remain predictable.

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `npm run dev`: Launches the Next.js dev server with React Fast Refresh.
- `npm run build`: Produces an optimized production bundle; run before deploys.
- `npm run start`: Serves the latest build locally for smoke-testing production output.
- `npm run lint`: Executes the project-wide ESLint rules (Next.js core-web-vitals baseline). Treat warnings as errors before opening a PR.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
Use modern ES modules with functional React components. Prefer two-space indentation and trailing commas, matching the existing files. Components that render UI should use PascalCase filenames (`ThemeToggle.jsx`), hooks use camelCase prefixed with `use` (`use-mobile.js`), and utility modules go in `src/lib` with hyphenated names. Favor Tailwind classes for styling; co-locate any component-specific CSS in `src/styles` only if a utility class will not suffice. Run `npm run lint` to ensure ESLint (configured in `eslint.config.mjs`) flags accessibility and performance regressions early.

## Testing Guidelines
Automated tests are not yet wired in. When adding them, group specs beside their feature (`src/features/navigation/__tests__/NavMenu.test.jsx`) so intent is obvious. Name files with `.test.jsx` or `.test.js`. For critical flows lacking automation, document manual verification steps in the PR description and exercise them against `npm run start` output. Keep database interactions mocked or pointed at disposable fixtures to avoid mutating shared environments.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
Craft commit subjects in the imperative mood (“Add navigation badges”), roughly 50 characters, with optional detail in the body. Combine related changes rather than batching multiple features. Pull requests should include: a concise summary, linked issue IDs, screenshots or clip recordings for UI changes, and notes on testing performed (`npm run lint`, manual checks, etc.). Request reviews from owners of affected areas (`src/features/<feature>` or shared libs) before merging.

## Environment & Configuration Tips
Local MySQL connectivity is managed via `src/lib/db.js`, which reads `DB_HOST`, `DB_PORT`, `DB_USER`, `DB_PASSWORD`, and `DB_NAME`. Place secrets in `.env.local`; never commit credentials. Tailwind configuration is defined through `components.json` and `postcss.config.mjs`. If you introduce new design tokens, update `src/styles/tokens.css` and keep class names consistent with Tailwind’s utility-first approach.

<INSTRUCTIONS>
# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
Source code lives in `src`. Routes and layouts use the App Router under `src/app`, with segment folders like `src/app/[lineId]` for dynamic pages and `src/app/api` for server handlers. Reusable UI sits in `src/components`, while feature-specific logic is grouped inside `src/features/<feature>`. Shared hooks (`src/hooks`), database helpers (`src/lib`), and design tokens (`src/styles`) keep cross-cutting concerns centralized. Static assets (logos, favicons) belong in `public`. Keep new modules aligned with this layout so imports remain predictable.

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `npm run dev`: Launches the Next.js dev server with React Fast Refresh.
- `npm run build`: Produces an optimized production bundle; run before deploys.
- `npm run start`: Serves the latest build locally for smoke-testing production output.
- `npm run lint`: Executes the project-wide ESLint rules (Next.js core-web-vitals baseline). Treat warnings as errors before opening a PR.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
Use modern ES modules with functional React components. Prefer two-space indentation and trailing commas, matching the existing files. Components that render UI should use PascalCase filenames (`ThemeToggle.jsx`), hooks use camelCase prefixed with `use` (`use-mobile.js`), and utility modules go in `src/lib` with hyphenated names. Favor Tailwind classes for styling; co-locate any component-specific CSS in `src/styles` only if a utility class will not suffice. Run `npm run lint` to ensure ESLint (configured in `eslint.config.mjs`) flags accessibility and performance regressions early.

## Testing Guidelines
Automated tests are not yet wired in. When adding them, group specs beside their feature (`src/features/navigation/__tests__/NavMenu.test.jsx`) so intent is obvious. Name files with `.test.jsx` or `.test.js`. For critical flows lacking automation, document manual verification steps in the PR description and exercise them against `npm run start` output. Keep database interactions mocked or pointed at disposable fixtures to avoid mutating shared environments.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
Craft commit subjects in the imperative mood (“Add navigation badges”), roughly 50 characters, with optional detail in the body. Combine related changes rather than batching multiple features. Pull requests should include: a concise summary, linked issue IDs, screenshots or clip recordings for UI changes, and notes on testing performed (`npm run lint`, manual checks, etc.). Request reviews from owners of affected areas (`src/features/<feature>` or shared libs) before merging.

## Environment & Configuration Tips
Local MySQL connectivity is managed via `src/lib/db.js`, which reads `DB_HOST`, `DB_PORT`, `DB_USER`, `DB_PASSWORD`, and `DB_NAME`. Place secrets in `.env.local`; never commit credentials. Tailwind configuration is defined through `components.json` and `postcss.config.mjs`. If you introduce new design tokens, update `src/styles/tokens.css` and keep class names consistent with Tailwind’s utility-first approach.

</INSTRUCTIONS>

payload.message:
- Updated the `.dark` token palette to a neutral gray scheme so every dark-mode surface (background, cards, popovers, inputs, borders, etc.) now pulls from gray-scale OKLCH values while preserving the sidebar variables untouched, satisfying the “sidebar stays the same” requirement (`apps/web/src/styles/tokens.css:79`).
- Left the chart and sidebar colors alone so existing dashboards and navigation accents retain their intended emphasis.

Tests not run (not requested). Consider spinning up `npm run dev` to confirm the new gray palette matches expectations across screens.

payload.message: 이 프로젝트의 코드를 작성할때 지켜야할 수칙 말해봐

- Repository keeps source under `src`, with app routes in `src/app` (Next.js App Router), shared UI in `src/components`, feature-specific logic inside `src/features/<feature>`, hooks in `src/hooks`, shared libs in `src/lib`, styles/tokens under `src/styles`, and assets in `public`.
- Dev scripts: `npm run dev` (Next dev server), `npm run build` (prod bundle before deploy), `npm run start` (serve built app for smoke tests), `npm run lint` (ESLint; treat warnings as errors).
- Coding style: modern ES modules, functional components, two-space indentation, trailing commas. PascalCase for UI component files (e.g., `ThemeToggle.jsx`), camelCase `use` prefix for hooks, hyphenated utility modules in `src/lib`. Prefer Tailwind for styling; only add CSS to `src/styles` when utilities fall short. Run `npm run lint` to catch a11y/perf issues (`eslint.config.mjs`).
- Testing: automated tests not yet wired. When adding, place `*.test.jsx/js` beside the feature (e.g., `src/features/navigation/__tests__/NavMenu.test.jsx`). Document manual checks in PRs and validate against `npm run start`. Mock DB interactions.
- Git hygiene: commits in imperative mood (~50 chars) with focused scope. PRs need summary, linked issues, UI screenshots/recordings if relevant, and testing notes (`npm run lint`, manual). Request review from relevant feature owners.
- Env/config: DB helper `src/lib/db.js` reads `DB_*` env vars. Secrets go in `.env.local`. Tailwind config via `components.json` and `postcss.config.mjs`. Update `src/styles/tokens.css` when adding design tokens and keep class names aligned with Tailwind conventions.

payload.message:
- 소스 구조: 모든 코드는 `src` 아래에 두며, Next.js App Router 경로는 `src/app`(예: `src/app/[lineId]`, `src/app/api`). 재사용 UI는 `src/components`, 기능별 로직은 `src/features/<feature>`, 공용 훅은 `src/hooks`, DB/유틸은 `src/lib`, 디자인 토큰은 `src/styles`, 정적 자산은 `public`에 둡니다. 새 파일도 이 구조를 따르세요.
- 빌드·검증: `npm run dev`(개발 서버), `npm run build`(배포용 번들), `npm run start`(배포 번들 스모크 테스트), `npm run lint`(ESLint, 경고도 오류로 간주) 명령을 사용합니다.
- 코딩 스타일: 현대 ES 모듈과 함수형 컴포넌트를 사용하고 들여쓰기는 2칸, 후행 쉼표를 유지합니다. UI 컴포넌트 파일은 PascalCase(`ThemeToggle.jsx`), 훅은 `use` 접두사의 camelCase, `src/lib` 유틸은 하이픈 이름을 씁니다. 스타일은 Tailwind 우선, 필요한 경우에만 `src/styles`에 CSS를 추가하고 ESLint(`eslint.config.mjs`)로 접근성/성능을 확인합니다.
- 테스트: 자동 테스트는 미구성입니다. 작성 시 해당 기능 폴더(`src/features/.../__tests__/Foo.test.jsx`)에 두고, 핵심 흐름은 PR 설명에 수동 검증 절차를 적고 `npm run start` 결과로 확인합니다. DB 연동은 모킹하거나 폐기 가능한 고정 데이터를 사용합니다.
- 커밋/PR: 커밋 제목은 명령형(~50자)으로 관련 변경만 묶습니다. PR에는 요약, 이슈 링크, UI 변경 시 스크린샷/영상, 수행한 테스트(`npm run lint`, 수동 확인)를 포함하고 해당 영역 담당자에게 리뷰를 요청합니다.
- 환경/설정: `src/lib/db.js`가 `DB_HOST`, `DB_PORT`, `DB_USER`, `DB_PASSWORD`, `DB_NAME`를 읽습니다. 비밀키는 `.env.local`에만 보관합니다. Tailwind 설정은 `components.json`, `postcss.config.mjs`로 관리하고, 토큰을 추가할 땐 `src/styles/tokens.css`를 갱신하며 Tailwind 유틸 클래스 컨벤션을 지킵니다.

payload.message:
- Sonner 토스트가 밝은 배경으로 고정됐던 부분을 토큰 기반으로 변경했습니다. 이제 `buildToastOptions`에서 기본 배경·글자색·테두리를 `var(--popover)`, `var(--popover-foreground)`, `var(--border)`로 가져와서 다크 모드에서도 자연스럽게 전환됩니다 (`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/utils/toast.js:1`).
- 다크 테마 토큰 자체도 회색 계열 값으로 재정비하여 팝업·카드 등 전체 다크 UI가 그레이 톤을 사용하도록 했지만 사이드바 변수는 유지했습니다 (`apps/web/src/styles/tokens.css:79`).

테스트는 수행하지 않았습니다. 필요하면 `npm run dev`로 토스트 호출 시 밝은/어두운 모드 모두 확인해 보세요.

content.text:
- Sonner 토스트가 밝은 배경으로 고정됐던 부분을 토큰 기반으로 변경했습니다. 이제 `buildToastOptions`에서 기본 배경·글자색·테두리를 `var(--popover)`, `var(--popover-foreground)`, `var(--border)`로 가져와서 다크 모드에서도 자연스럽게 전환됩니다 (`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/utils/toast.js:1`).
- 다크 테마 토큰 자체도 회색 계열 값으로 재정비하여 팝업·카드 등 전체 다크 UI가 그레이 톤을 사용하도록 했지만 사이드바 변수는 유지했습니다 (`apps/web/src/styles/tokens.css:79`).

테스트는 수행하지 않았습니다. 필요하면 `npm run dev`로 토스트 호출 시 밝은/어두운 모드 모두 확인해 보세요.

This will involve multi-step updates: adding the dependency, creating the slider component, and integrating it into quick filters, so I plan to formulate a detailed plan before proceeding.

payload.text:
**Summarizing quick filter slider updates**

I've got a clear plan to explain the slider additions to the QuickFilters UI, the updated logic allowing custom values and forceValue flags, the new Radix-based Slider component with its dependencies, and the relevant tests, all organized with precise file references and a helpful next step for testing.

payload.message:
Quick Filters now ship with a 1–36h slider so operators can dial in the time window directly in the panel.

- Quick filter rendering detects the `recent_hours` section and routes it through a dedicated component that keeps the preset buttons and adds a slider with an 8h default, committing values with `forceValue` so dragging never clears the filter (apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/filters/QuickFilters.jsx:60 and apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/filters/QuickFilters.jsx:268).
- Filter definitions export the hour min/max/default constants, seed the initial state with 8h, mark the section as `allowCustomValue`, and relax sync validation so arbitrary slider selections persist (apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/filters/quickFilters.js:13 and apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/filters/quickFilters.js:226).
- `useQuickFilters` now accepts an optional `{ forceValue: true }` flag so the slider can set precise hours without being toggled off when the same value repeats (apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/hooks/useQuickFilters.js:44).
- Added a reusable Radix-based `Slider` UI primitive and brought in `@radix-ui/react-slider` to back it, giving the quick filter a consistent thumb/track look (apps/web/src/components/ui/slider.jsx:1 and apps/web/package.json:19).

- Tests: `npm run lint`

Next step: run `npm run dev`, drag the quick-filter slider through several hour marks (including clearing with “전체”) and confirm the table updates across the 1–36h range.

payload.text:
**Resolving dependency and slider implementation issues**

I'm figuring out that pnpm creates a `.pnpm` folder without hoisting to root `node_modules`, causing module not found errors for `@radix-ui/react-slider`. To fix this, I'll remove the radix-slider dependency and implement a simple slider component using a native `<input type="range">` with Tailwind CSS for styling. I'll update the slider to support the same API (`value`, `onValueChange`, `onValueCommit`) and adjust QuickFilters accordingly. Then I'll uninstall `@radix-ui/react-slider` from `apps/web` to clean up dependencies and update the package-lock properly. This approach avoids dependency issues and simplifies the slider while maintaining expected functionality.

payload.message:
- Replaced the Radix dependency with a bespoke slider so bundling no longer errors on `@radix-ui/react-slider`. The new component wraps a native `range` input with a styled track/thumb overlay and still emits `onValueChange`/`onValueCommit` arrays for compatibility (`apps/web/src/components/ui/slider.jsx:1`), and the package.json entry for the removed dependency was dropped (`apps/web/package.json:18`).
- Hooked the recent-hours quick filter into that slider: it renders the presets plus the new control, syncs its internal state with the filter value, and forces committed hour values instead of toggling them away (`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/filters/QuickFilters.jsx:60`). Clearing returns to “전체”, while the slider maintains the requested hour span display.
- The filter definitions now expose min/max/default constants, seed the initial quick-filter state with an 8‑hour window, flag `recent_hours` as allowing custom values, and relax sync validation so arbitrary slider selections don’t get reset (`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/filters/quickFilters.js:13` and `apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/filters/quickFilters.js:226`). `useQuickFilters` accepts an optional `{ forceValue: true }` so the slider can push exact hour values without toggle behavior (`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/hooks/useQuickFilters.js:44`).

Tests: `npm run lint`

Next step: run `npm run dev`, open the quick filter, and drag the slider across various hour marks (including 36h) to confirm rows update and the import error stays gone.

The new component wraps a native `range` input with a styled track/thumb overlay and still emits `onValueChange`/`onValueCommit` arrays for compatibility (`apps/web/src/components/ui/slider.jsx:1`), and the package.json entry for the removed dependency was dropped (`apps/web/package.json:18`).

Clearing returns to “전체”, while the slider maintains the requested hour span display.
- The filter definitions now expose min/max/default constants, seed the initial quick-filter state with an 8‑hour window, flag `recent_hours` as allowing custom values, and relax sync validation so arbitrary slider selections don’t get reset (`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/filters/quickFilters.js:13` and `apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/filters/quickFilters.js:226`). `useQuickFilters` accepts an optional `{ forceValue: true }` so the slider can push exact hour values without toggle behavior (`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/hooks/useQuickFilters.js:44`).

Tests: `npm run lint`

Next step: run `npm run dev`, open the quick filter, and drag the slider across various hour marks (including 36h) to confirm rows update and the import error stays gone.

payload.message:
- Recent-hours quick filter now keeps only the slider UI: all preset buttons and min/max edge labels were removed, replaced by a centered “최근 N시간 전” readout and a helper caption indicating “← 오래된 시간 | 최신 →” (`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/filters/QuickFilters.jsx:268`).
- Slider interaction is inverted so dragging left moves further into the past: the control internally maps the 0…35 slider range back to 36…1 hours, clamps consistently, and still writes the selected hour count through `onToggle` with `forceValue` so filtering logic stays in sync.

테스트: `npm run lint`
